title: Aurizon onboards bankers for Genesee & Wyoming Australia
text:
Goldman Sachs' investment banking team has first-class seats as Aurizon rails against America's Genesee & Wyoming for control of its Australian assets.

Street Talk understands Aurizon has tapped Goldman Sachs for advice on the sticky situation, which is before the courts and could end in anything from a $2 billion acquisition opportunity to an embarrassing mess.

There's a fresh set of eyes helping Aurizon boss Andrew Harding consider Genesee & Wyoming Australia. Louie Douvis

To recap, Aurizon is trying to stop G&W selling its Australian arm Genesee & Wyoming Australia (GWA) to Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets and Dutch pension fund PGGM.

Aurizon claims it has right of first refusal on the transaction, which dates back to an earlier deal between the pair in 2006, while G &W is disputing the assertion.

At best, and assuming clearance from the corporate regulator, ASX-listed Aurizon could end up with GWA's valuable Hunter Valley coal network, as well as its Darwin-to-Tarcoola (in South Australia) rail line, hauling bulk commodities and intermodal goods.
description: Goldman Sachs has great seats as Aurizon rails against America's Genesee & Wyoming for control of its Australian assets.
